snippet: As a policy aide on George W. Bush’s 2000 presidential campaign, Ted Cruz advocated for a softer position on immigration than he calls for today.
abstract: Document written by Sen Ted Cruz when he served as policy aide for George W Bush's presidential campaign in 2000 reveals Cruz had more moderate position on issue of illegal immigration; Cruz has adopted far more hard-line position amid his own presidential campaign and staunchly opposes legalization for those in country illegally.

byline.contributor: Yamiche Alcindor contributed reporting from Las Vegas.

lead_paragraph: As a policy aide on George W. Bush’s 2000 presidential campaign, Ted Cruz advocated for a softer position on immigration than he calls for today.

headline.main: In 1999 Memo, Ted Cruz Took Milder Tone on Immigration
headline.print_headline: Milder Immigration Tone From Cruz as Young Aide
